result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathaniel Niles Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any sentence. Release for the Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments only.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent.  Any cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Regular participation in a HSED or GED.  Seek/maintain full time employment.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

No alcohol.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription; taken in  the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine or any body armor.
Comply with all child support Court orders.

Comply with all Children's Court orders.
Complete parenting or fatherhood course.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment includig drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel Niles Cooper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nathaniel Niles Cooper in court with Student Intern Michelle Cahoon under the supervision of attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT  1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for The Day Reporting Center and inmate work assignments only; credit for 9 days time served. Count notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  12 MONTHS with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Regular participation in a HSED or GED. 
- Seek /Maintain Full Time employment. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all Childrens Court  orders. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders. 
- Complete Parenting  or Fatherhood course. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge,  during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated April 20, 2015, received and filed. tk

Defendant Nathaniel Niles Cooper in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Held off the record. Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Court is down.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report, dated April 10, 2015 received and filed. tk

Defendant Nathaniel Niles Cooper in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case held off the record. Defense counsel received discovery and requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on 4-13-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated February 9, 2015, received and filed.

15RM004013  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01-29-2015

Defendant Nathaniel Niles Cooper in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Nathaniel Niles Cooper in custody.  David Behn for Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Nathaniel Niles Cooper
Current: 5716 N 57th Street, #110, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 01-22-2015)
Prior: 5830 North 67th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Nathaniel Niles Cooper in court with Student Intern Michelle Cahoon under the supervision of attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Nathaniel Niles Cooper in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
